intro: Arachniodes guangtongensis, commonly known as Guangtong fern, is a species of fern native to China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often pinnate fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forests or rocky areas. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a leathery texture. The spores are produced on the underside of the fronds, which are arranged in clusters.
